org.kududb.client

Class DeadlineTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kududb.client.DeadlineTracker

  • public class DeadlineTracker
extends Object
    This is a wrapper class around Stopwatch used to track a relative deadline in the future.

    The watch starts as soon as this object is created with a deadline of 0, meaning that there's no deadline. The deadline has been reached once the stopwatch's elapsed time is equal or greater than the provided deadline.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeadlineTracker()
      Creates a new tracker, which starts the stopwatch right now.
      DeadlineTracker(com.google.common.base.Stopwatch stopwatch)
      Creates a new tracker, using the specified stopwatch, and starts it right now.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeadlineTracker

        public DeadlineTracker()
        Creates a new tracker, which starts the stopwatch right now.

      • DeadlineTracker

        public DeadlineTracker(com.google.common.base.Stopwatch stopwatch)
        Creates a new tracker, using the specified stopwatch, and starts it right now. The stopwatch is reset if it was already running.
        Parameters:
        stopwatch - Specific Stopwatch to use

    • Method Detail

      • timedOut

        public boolean timedOut()
        Check if we're already past the deadline.
        Returns:
        true if we're past the deadline, otherwise false. Also returns false if no deadline was specified

      • getMillisBeforeDeadline

        public long getMillisBeforeDeadline()
        Get the number of milliseconds before the deadline is reached.

        This method is used to pass down the remaining deadline to the RPCs, so has special semantics. A deadline of 0 is used to indicate an infinite deadline, and negative deadlines are invalid. Thus, if the deadline has passed (i.e. deadline - stopwatch.elapsedMillis() <= 0), the returned value is floored at 1.

        Callers who care about this behavior should first check timedOut().

        Returns:
        the remaining millis before the deadline is reached, or 1 if the remaining time is lesser or equal to 0, or Long.MAX_VALUE if no deadline was specified (in which case it should never be called).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called and no deadline was set

      • getElapsedMillis

        public long getElapsedMillis()

      • hasDeadline

        public boolean hasDeadline()
        Tells if a non-zero deadline was set.
        Returns:
        true if the deadline is greater than 0, false otherwise.

      • wouldSleepingTimeout

        public boolean wouldSleepingTimeout(long plannedSleepTime)
        Utility method to check if sleeping for a specified amount of time would put us past the deadline.
        Parameters:
        plannedSleepTime - number of milliseconds for a planned sleep
        Returns:
        if the planned sleeps goes past the deadline.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the deadline to 0 (no deadline) and restarts the stopwatch from scratch.

      • getDeadline

        public long getDeadline()
        Get the deadline (in milliseconds).
        Returns:
        the current deadline

      • setDeadline

        public void setDeadline(long deadline)
        Set a new deadline for this tracker. It cannot be smaller than 0, and if it is 0 then it means that there is no deadline (which is the default behavior). This method won't call reset().
        Parameters:
        deadline - a number of milliseconds greater or equal to 0
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the deadline is lesser than 0

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
